World History.name: Echoes of the Roaring Twenties
World History.description: Delve into the tumultuous era of the Great Depression and the cultural shifts of the 20th century. This quiz explores key events and figures that shaped America's past, from presidential legacies to iconic moments in American history.

questions.text: In what year did the Great Depression begin?
questions.hint: This economic crisis started with a major stock market crash in the late 1920s.

questions.text: What U.S. president is mentioned by name in the opening theme song of TV's 'All in the Family'?
questions.hint: This president’s name appears in the lyric reminiscing about a time when ‘things were swell.’

questions.text: The American patriot Paul Revere was named for his father, whose original name was what?
questions.hint: His father’s original name reflects French Huguenot heritage before anglicization.

questions.text: How many states were in the Confederate States of America?

questions.text: During which war did US troops fight the Battle of New Orleans?

questions.text: Where did Lewis and Clark begin their famous expedition in 1804?

questions.text: What is the oldest permanent European settlement in the United States?
questions.hint: This Florida city was founded by the Spanish in the 16th century.
